body.p: Here are some guidelines for writing XPath expressions. These are used to extract the content from the merged DITA map document (this is in HTML format if using the pdf-css-html5 transformation, or in DITA XML format for pdf-css transformation).
This is an example in which we place the product name meta-information before the front page title.

ol.li: Do not use directly the DITA element names. You must use the DITA class attribute instead, as these attributes are propagated to the merged elements (including HTML divs) while the element names can be lost. By using the class selectors you also cover the DITA specializations.

Use the "[1]" XPath predicate to select the first value from the document, for instance: oxy_xpath("(//*[contains(@class, 'topic/prodname')]/text())[1]"). The meta-information might be copied multiple times in the output, inherited by the topicref elements, so you can get many more values than expected.
Do not use strings as values for the pseudo elements content, but use the XPath directly. The string values are not supported for pseudo elements.
Use the XPath builder from oXygen to test the XPath expressions.
